intro: Nemesia pulchella, commonly known as the common nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist conditions and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. Nemesia pulchella is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
